alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:59PM EST until January 10 at 8:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Saddle River near Lodi affecting Bergen County. For the Saddle River...including Lodi...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saddle River near Lodi. * WHEN...Until this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM EST Wednesday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 2.8 feet Friday evening. It will then rise to flood stage Saturday morning. It will fall for the remainder of the period. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.9 feet on 04/04/1987. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Saddle River Lodi 5.5 6.9 Wed 2 pm EST 3.2 2.8 4.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EST.
